alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 28 at 2:00PM MDT until October 30 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MDT SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures between 28 to 32 degrees expected, especially Monday morning. * WHERE...Lower Washington County. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon MDT Sunday. For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 10 AM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. A few power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult due to crosswinds, especially for high profile vehicles and vehicles with trailers. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Sunday morning expect most elevations below roughly 3500 feet to remain above freezing. During the day on Sunday, temperatures will rise back above freezing. By Monday morning the remaining elevations in Washington County will likely be near, or below, freezing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
